page.content: to Rushock,were in Chaddesley Corbet and Droitwich.The Post was only delivered once,and collected once,and the only real communication between the community,was on Sundays at the local church.Nowadays,there is only one priest to four parishes.People had to make their own clothes and furniture,as there were no workmen and carpenters nearby.The nearest coal merchant was probably in Bromsgrove, and all cooking was done on coal stoves and fires. Recently,many commuters have moved into the village,and many of them would like to take over and keep the old traditions going.Unfortunately they have split the community.
